article.paragraph: Billy Bob Thorntoncite episodeBilly Bob ThorntonInside the Actors StudioInside the Actors StudioAugust 18, 2002http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0611331/818cite newsUSA TodayArleneVigodaFebruary 7, 19971D LIFEThornton makes a mark with 'Sling Blade'September 9, 2011cite news[[Orange Coast Magazine]]Betsy ModelJanuary 2004Rock-a-Billy Bob54301(born August 4, 1955)cite newsMonitor[[Entertainment Weekly]][[Time Inc.]]August 10, 2012121927is an American actor, filmmaker, singer-songwriter and drummer. Thornton made his first break with co-writing and starring in the 1992 thrillerOne False Moveand came to international attention after writing, directing, and starring in theindependent filmindependent dramaSling Blade(1996), for which he won anAcademy Award for Best Writing (Adapted Screenplay)Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplayand was nominated for anAcademy Award for Best Actor. He appeared in several major film roles in the 1990s followingSling Blade, includingOliver Stone's neo-noirU Turn (1997 film)U Turn(1997), political dramaPrimary Colors (film)Primary Colors(1998), science fiction disasterArmageddon (1998 film)Armageddon(1998), which was the highest-grossing film of that year and the crime dramaA Simple Plan (film)A Simple Plan(1998), which earned him his thirdAcademy AwardsOscarnomination.

In the 2000s, he achieved further success in starring dramasMonster's Ball(2001),The Man Who Wasn't There (2001 film)The Man Who Wasn't There(2001),Friday Night Lights (film)Friday Night Lights(2004), comediesBandits (2001 film)Bandits(2001),Intolerable Cruelty(2003),Bad Santa(2003) and actionsEagle Eye(2008) andFaster (2010 film)Faster(2010). In 2014, Thornton starred in the anthology seriesFargo (TV series)Fargoand earned a nomination for thePrimetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Miniseries or a MovieOutstanding Lead Actor in a Miniseries or TV Movieat the66th Primetime Emmy AwardsEmmy Awardsand wonGolden Globe Award for Best Actor - Miniseries or Television FilmBest Actor in a Miniseries or TV Filmat the72nd Golden Globe Awards.

Thornton is cited as an "anti-film star" who approaches his roles like acharacter actorand rarely accepts roles inBlockbuster (entertainment)blockbusters. He has been vocal about his disrespect forcelebrity culture, choosing to keep his life out of the public eye. However, the attention of the media has proven unavoidable in certain cases, his marriage toAngelina Joliebeing a notable example.Interview with Mark Polish, Michael Polish & Billy Bob Thornton - Combustible CelluloidAs an influential actor, Thornton is known for his diversity, wide range, and prolificacy, appearing in at least one film per year nearly every year since 1991.Thornton has written a variety of films, usually set in theSouthern United Statesand mainly co-written withTom Epperson, includingA Family Thing(1996) andThe Gift (2000 film)The Gift(2000). AfterSling Blade, he directed several other films, includingDaddy and Them(2001),All the Pretty Horses (film)All the Pretty Horses(2000), andJayne Mansfield's Car(2012).

Thornton has received the President's Award fromAcademy of Science Fiction, Fantasy & Horror Films, a Special Achievement Award fromNational Board of Review, and a star on theHollywood Walk of Fame. He was also nominated for anEmmy Award, fourGolden Globes, and threeScreen Actors Guild Awards. In addition to film work, Thornton began a career as a singer-songwriter. He has released four solo albums and is the vocalist of ablues rockbandThe Boxmasters.
article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: Thornton was born inHot Springs, Arkansas,cite webhttp://www.biography.com/people/billy-bob-thornton-9542137#awesmBilly Bob Thornton Biography[[The Biography Channel]]30 June 2014cite webhttp://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/1405849/Billy-Bob-ThorntonBilly Bob Thornton (American actor, director, and writer)[[Encyclopædia Britannica Online]]30 August 2014the son of Virginia Roberta (ne Faulkner), apsychic, and William Raymond "Billy Ray" Thornton (November 1929 August 1974), a high school history teacher and basketball coach who died when Thornton was eighteen.At seven months of age, Thornton set the Clark County record for heaviest infant, at thirty pounds. He was one of three brothers with Jimmy Don (April 1958 October 1988), who died of a heart attack at 30, and John David (born 1969), who resides inCalifornia. Jimmy Don wrote a number of songs, two of which ("Island Avenue" and "Emily") Thornton has recorded on his solo albums.cite webhttp://ssdi.rootsweb.ancestry.comSocial Security Death IndexSsdi.rootsweb.ancestry.comMay 9, 2010During his childhood, Thornton lived inAlpine, ArkansasandMalvern, Arkansas. He was raised aMethodist,cite webhttp://www.beliefnet.com/story/212/story_21242.htmlBilly Bob Thornton, Astronaut FarmerBeliefNet.comin an extended family in a shack that had neither electricity nor plumbing.http://www.thebiographychannel.co.uk/biographies/billy-bob-thornton.htmlHe graduated from high school in 1973.cite webhttp://encyclopediaofarkansas.net/encyclopedia/entry-detail.aspx?entryIDEncyclopedia of Arkansas History & CultureEncyclopediaofarkansas.netMay 9, 2010A good high schoolbaseballplayer, he tried out for theKansas City Royals, but was released after an injury.cite newshttp://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/ingear/cars/article71999.eceOn the Move: Billy Bob ThorntonThe TimesSeptember 23, 2007LondonNovember 10, 2014GillPringleAfter a short period laying asphalt for theArkansas State Highway and Transportation DepartmentArkansas State Transportation Department, he attendedHenderson State Universityto pursue studies in psychology, but dropped out after two semesters.citation neededSeptember 2014

In the mid-1980s, Thornton settled inLos Angelesto pursue his career as an actor, with future writing partner Tom Epperson.He initially had a difficult time succeeding as an actor, and worked intelemarketing,offshore constructionoffshorewind farming,andfast foodmanagement between auditioning for acting jobs. He also played drums and sang with South African rock band Jack Hammer. While Thornton worked as a waiter for an industry event, he served film director and screenwriterBilly Wilder. Thornton struck up a conversation with Wilder, who advised Thornton to consider a career as a screenwriter.
article.heading: Career
Acting and filmmaking
article.paragraph: File:BillyBobThorntonPointsSXSW2009 (cropped).jpgthumbrightThornton at theSouth by SouthwestinAustin, Texason March 11, 2008Thornton's first screen role was in 1980'sSouth of Reno, where he played a small role as a counter man in a restaurant. He also made an appearance as a pawn store clerk in the 1987Matlock (TV series)Matlockepisode "The Photographer". Another one of his early screen roles was as a cast member on the CBS sitcomHearts Afire. His role as the villain in 1992'sOne False Move, which he also co-wrote, brought him to the attention of critics. He also had small roles in the 1990s filmsIndecent Proposal,On Deadly Ground,Bound by Honor, andTombstone (film)Tombstone. He went on to write, direct, and star in the 1996independent filmSling Blade.The film, an expansion of the short filmSome Folks Call It a Sling Blade, introduced the story of amentally handicappedman imprisoned for a gruesome and seemingly inexplicable murder.citation neededSeptember 2014

Sling Bladegarnered international acclaim. Thornton's screenplay earned him anAcademy Awardfor Best Adapted Screenplay, aWriters Guild of America Award, and anEdgar Award, while his performance received Oscar andScreen Actors Guildnominations for Best Actor.In 1998, Thornton portrayed theJames Carville-like Richard Jemmons inPrimary Colors (film)Primary Colors. He adapted the bookAll the Pretty Horses (novel)All the Pretty Horsesinto a 2000All the Pretty Horses (film)film of the same name. The negative experience (he was forced to cut more than an hour of footage) led to his decision to never direct another film; a subsequent release,Daddy and Them, had been filmed earlier. Also in 2000, an early script which he andTom Eppersonwrote together was made intoThe Gift (2000 film)The Gift.citation neededSeptember 2014

In 2000, Thornton appeared inTravis Tritt's music video for the song "Modern Day Bonnie and Clyde". His screen persona has been described by the press as that of a "tattooed, hirsute man's man".cite webJAM! ShowbizBilly Bob Hollywood's go-to guyhttp://jam.canoe.ca/Movies/2006/09/24/1888691.htmlSeptember 24, 2006He appeared in several major film roles following the success ofSling Blade, including 1998'sArmageddon (1998 film)ArmageddonandA Simple Plan (film)A Simple Plan. In 2001, he directedDaddy and Themwhile securing starring roles in three Hollywood films:Monster's Ball,Bandits (2001 film)Bandits, andThe Man Who Wasn't There (2001 film)The Man Who Wasn't There, for which he received many awards.citation neededSeptember 2014

Thornton played a malicious mallSanta ClausSantain 2003'sBad Santa, ablack comedythat performed well at the box office and established him as a leading comic actor, and in the same year, portrayed a womanizingPresident of the United Statesin the British romantic comedy filmLove Actually. He stated that, following the success ofBad Santa, audiences "like to watch him play that kind of guy" and that "casting directors call him up when they need an asshole".He referred to this when he said that "it's kinda that simple... you know how narrow the imagination in this business can be".cite webLos Angeles Daily NewsSchool is in sessionhttp://www.dailynews.com/entertainment/ci_4386629September 24, 2006yeshttps://web.archive.org/20070928003839/http://www.dailynews.com/entertainment/ci_438662928 September 2007

In 2004, Thornton playedDavid CrockettinThe Alamo (2004 film)The Alamo. Later that year, he received a star on theHollywood Walk of Fameon October 7, 2004. He appeared in the 2006 comic filmSchool for Scoundrels (2006 film)School for Scoundrels. In the film, he plays a self-help doctor, which was written specifically for him.More recent films include 2007 dramaThe Astronaut Farmerand the comedyMr. Woodcock, in which he played asadomasochismsadisticgym teacher. In September 2008, he starred in the action filmEagle Eye. He has also expressed an interest in directing another film, possibly aperiod pieceabout cave explorerFloyd Collins,cite webAbout.comInterview with "School for Scoundrels" Star Billy Bob Thorntonhttp://movies.about.com/od/schoolforscoundrels/a/schoolbt091506_2.htmSeptember 25, 2006based on the bookTrapped! The Story of Floyd Collins.citation neededSeptember 2014
In 2014, Thornton starred as sociopathic hitman Lorne Malvo in the FX miniseriesFargo (TV series)Fargo, based on the 1996Fargo (film)film of the same name.citation neededSeptember 2014
On October 30, 2014, onThe Big Bang Theory, he played a middle-agedUrologyurologistwho gets excited about every woman who touches him. He showed the boys his collection offilm memorabilia.
article.heading: Music
article.paragraph: During the late 1990s, Thornton, who has had a lifelong love for music, began a hobby as a singer-songwriter. He released aroots rockalbum titledPrivate Radioin 2001, and three more albums,The Edge of the World (Billy Bob Thornton album)The Edge of the World(2003),Hobo (Billy Bob Thornton album)Hobo(2005) andBeautiful Door (album)Beautiful Door(2007). Thornton's manager,David Spero, helped hisEdge of the Worldalbum get off the ground with a summer tour.cite webhttp://www.deannaadams.com/articles.htmNorthern Ohio Live, September 2003June 5, 2010Deanna R. AdamsThornton was the singer of ablues musicbluesrock band namedTres Hombres. GuitaristBilly Gibbonsreferred to the band as "The best littlecover bandin Texas", and Thornton bears a tattoo with the band's name on it.cite webBillyBobThornton.netBilly Bob's Musichttp://www.billybobthornton.net/music%20recordings%20gunslinger.htmSeptember 24, 2006http://web.archive.org/web/20060825234723/http://www.billybobthornton.net/music+recordings+gunslinger.htmAugust 25, 2006He performed theWarren ZevonsongThe Windon the tribute albumEnjoy Every Sandwich: Songs of Warren Zevon. Thornton recorded a cover of theJohnny Cashclassic "Ring of Fire (song)Ring of Fire" for theOxford Americanmagazine's Southern Music CD in 2001.citation neededSeptember 2014
article.heading: CBC incident
article.paragraph: On April 8, 2009, Thornton and his musical groupThe Boxmastersappeared onCBC Radio OneprogramQ (radio show)Qwhich was widely criticized and received international attention after Thornton was persistently unintelligible and discourteous to hostJian Ghomeshi.cite webhttp://www.huffingtonpost.com/2009/04/08/billy-bob-thornton-gives-_n_184948.htmlBilly Bob Thornton Gives Bizarre Interview On Canadian RadioOctober 2, 2009April 8, 2009Huffington Postcite webhttp://www.smh.com.au/lifestyle/people/billy-bob-thornton-has-a-joaquin-phoenix-moment-20090410-a2io.htmlBilly Bob Thornton has a Joaquin Phoenix momentThe Sydney Morning HeraldOctober 2, 2009April 10, 2009Thornton eventually explained he had "instructed" the show's producers to not ask questions about his movie career.cite webhttp://www.upi.com/Entertainment_News/2009/04/09/Thornton-obnoxious-in-CBC-interview/UPI-76871239285658/Thornton obnoxious in CBC interviewUPIApril 9, 2009cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/7991924.stmThornton clashes with radio hostBBCApril 9, 2009Ghomeshi had mentioned Thorntons acting in the introduction. Thornton had also complained Canadian audiences were like "mashed potatoes without the gravy."cite newshttp://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/article6067668.eceBilly Bob Thornton does a Joaquin Phoenix on Canadian radioThe TimesApril 9, 2009LondonApril 26, 2010VeronicaSchmidtcite newsRolling StoneDanielKrepsBilly Bob Thornton Attempts To Outdo Joaquin Phoenix In CBC InterviewApril 8, 2009http://www.rollingstone.com/rockdaily/index.php/2009/04/08/billy-bob-thornton-attempts-to-outdo-joaquin-phoenix-in-cbc-interview/The following night, opening forWillie Nelsonat Toronto'sMassey Hall, Thornton said mid-set he liked Canadians but not Ghomeshi, which was greeted with boos and catcalls.cite newshttp://www.thestar.com/entertainment/article/616601KenyonWallaceRaju MudharBilly Bob not done with the barbsThe StarApril 10, 2009TorontoThe Boxmasters did not continue the tour in Canada as, according to Thornton, some of the crew and band had the flu.cite newshttp://www.thestar.com/entertainment/article/616913IainMarlowAndrew ChungBilly Bob ends Canadian tourThe StarApril 10, 2009Toronto

article.heading: Personal life
Relationships and children
article.paragraph: File:Billy Bob Thornton.jpgthumbrightThornton at a San Francisco concert in 2007Thornton has been married six times, with the first five marriages ending in divorce, and he has four children by three women. From 1978 to 1980, he was married to Melissa Lee Gatlin, with whom he had a daughter, Amanda.cite journalCastroPeterPeter CastroApril 28, 1997Sling This: Mrs. Billy Bob Thornton Angrily Seeks a Divorce[[People (American magazine)|People]]4716July 6, 2011http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20121962,00.htmlhttp://www.webcitation.org/5zxnWvsjUJuly 6, 2011Thornton married actress Toni Lawrence in 1986; they separated the following year and divorced in 1988. From 1990 to 1992, he was married to actressCynda Williams, whom he cast in his writing debut,One False Move(1992). In 1993, Thornton marriedPlayboymodel Pietra Dawn Cherniak, with whom he had two sons, Harry James and William; the marriage ended in 1997, with Cherniak accusing Thornton ofspousal abuse.Hinckley, David.Billy Bob Thornton accused of stalking former sister-in-law.New York Daily News. May 21, 2008. Retrieved March 28, 2011.waybackhttp://articles.nydailynews.com/2008-05-21/gossip/17896987_1_stalking-accusations-claims20131105164123

Thornton was engaged to be married to actressLaura Dern, whom he dated from 1997 to 1999, but in 2000, he married actressAngelina Jolie, with whom he starred inPushing Tin(1999) and who is almost 20 years his junior (Jolie's fatherJon Voightis almost 17 years his senior and her late motherMarcheline Bertrandwas 5 years his senior). The marriage became known for the couple's eccentric displays of affection, which reportedly included wearing vials of each other's blood around their necks; Thornton later clarified that the "vials" were, instead, two small lockets, each containing only a single drop of blood.cite webhttp://men.msn.com/articlees.aspx?cp-documentidWhat I've Learned: Billy Bob ThorntonThornton and Jolie announced the adoption of a child fromCambodiain March 2002, but it was later revealed that Jolie had adopted the child as a single parent.Smolowee, Jill.Marriage, Interrupted.People. August 5, 2002. Retrieved March 2, 2011.Stein, Ruthe.Billy Bob Thornton Likes Staying Put. "San Francisco Chronicle". April 26, 2009. Retrieved March 2, 2011.They separated in June 2002 and divorced the following year.citation neededSeptember 2014

Since 2003, Thornton has been in a relationship with makeup effects crew member Connie Angland, with whom he has a daughter, Bella. The family lives in Los Angeles, California. Thornton has said that he likely will not marry again,cite newsThornton swears off marriagehttp://www.showbizspy.com/article/113789/thornton-swears-off-marriage.htmlShowbizSpyJuly 21, 2008July 6, 2011http://www.webcitation.org/5zxoGIkF5July 6, 2011saying that he believes marriage "doesn't work" for him.The Billy Bob Tapes: A Cave Full of GhostsB.B. Thornton. 2012. Virgin DigitalIn February 2015, Thornton's representatives confirmed that he and Angland were married on October 22, 2014 inLos Angeles,California.cite webhttp://www.people.com/article/billy-bob-thornton-marriedBilly Bob Thornton Weds Long-Time Girlfriend Connie Angland – in October!''People''February 21, 2015February 21, 2015
article.heading: Health issues
article.paragraph: During his early years in Los Angeles, Thornton was admitted to a hospital and diagnosed withmyocarditis, a heart condition that has been related to malnutrition.Billy Bob Thornton BiographyTheBiographyChannel.co.uk. Retrieved March 29, 2011.He has since said that he isveganand "extremely healthy.""Who Got Billy Bob Thornton To Dress Up as A Ladybug,"People, 14 June 2014.

Thornton hasobsessivecompulsive disorder.cite newsBilly Bob Thornton opens upmsnbc.comhttp://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/4654882April 2, 2004December 6, 2009Various idiosyncratic behaviors have been well documented in interviews with Thornton; among these is aphobiaof antique furniturea disorder shared byDwight Yoakam's character Doyle Hargraves in the Thornton-pennedSling Blade, and by Thornton's own character in the 2001 filmBandits.Additionally, he has stated that he has a fear of certain types ofcutlerysilverware, a trait assumed by his character Hank Grotowski in 2001'sMonster's Ball, in which Grotowski insists on a plastic spoon for his daily bowl of chocolate ice cream.cite webCinema.comBilly Bob's Fear Of Spoonshttp://www.cinema.com/news/item/5656/billy-bobs-fear-of-spoons.phtmlSeptember 24, 2006cite webScript-o-rama.comMonster's Ball screenplay transcripthttp://www.script-o-rama.com/movie_scripts/m/monsters-ball-script-transcript-halle.htmlMay 30, 2008In a 2004 interview withThe Independent, Thornton explained: "It's just that I won't use realsterling silversilver. You know, like the big, old, heavy-ass forks and knives, I can't do that. It's the same thing as the antique furniture. I just don't like old stuff. I'm creeped out by it, and I have no explanation why...I don't have a phobia about American antiques, it's mostly Frenchyou know, like the big, old, gold-carved chairs with thevelvetcushions. TheLouis XIVtype. That's what creeps me out. I can spot the imitation antiques a mile off. They have a different vibe. Not as much dust."cite newsIndependent.co.ukInterview with Billy Bob Thornton: Acting very strangeSeptember 3, 2004http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/film-and-tv/features/billy-bob-thornton-acting-very-strange-550994.htmlMay 30, 2008LondonTiffanyRose
article.heading: Other
article.paragraph: Thornton is a baseball fan, and his favorite team is theSt. Louis Cardinals. He has said that his childhood dream was to play for the Cardinals. He narratedThe 2006 World Series Film, the year-end retrospective DVD chronicling the Cardinals' championship season. Thornton is also a professed fan of theIndianapolis Coltsfootball team.cite webWaltonBrianExclusive Interview – Billy Bob Thornton – Part OneNovember 15, 2009http://stlcardinals.scout.com/2/396199.htmlwww.thestlcardinals.comJuly 17, 2005
